review: This movie was awful  .   As a comic book fan I felt like  MOVIE_DIRECTOR  just slapped me in the face by using so very little of the actual comics  . They were all too young so of course Reed Richards didn't have gray streaks  ,  who thought it would be a good idea to make a tiny guy the Thing ?   ,  and was it really necessary to make the Storm family have a "modern home" ?  That's more of a MOVIE_STORY that would fit in the X - Men )   ,  the origins dragged on for too long  ,  and their origin wasn't even the same ! Just because it's based on Marvel comics doesn't mean it's made by Marvel Studios  .   It's made by FOX  ,  which licensed the rights to the FF characters from Marvel years ago  .   Thus  ,  any comparisons to other MCU films such as the recent Ant - Man are totally meaningless  .   And that is why it's such a mess  .   Marvel had no control over what FOX did with their source material  .  For those not aware  ,  this film was plagued by problems from the start  .   The director was all but banned from the set and editing room in the final stage of production  ,  after which a good deal of the footage was dumped and re - MOVIE_SCENE   .   In the end  ,  it was slapped together by one of the producers and a temporary director  ,  and the results show :  there is a disconnect between the first two acts and the third  .   It's almost like there are two separate movies trying to co - exist  ,  and it doesn't work  .

Why was it made when the 2005 version got it so right ?

⭐️⭐️⭐️There has been much talk the past year surrounding this movie  .   Mostly negative it is sad to say with many rumors of a power struggle between Director  MOVIE_DIRECTOR  and Fox  .   It is more tragic that it has drained any positive hype which might have been prior  .   When Reed Richards  ,  Ben Grim  ,  Johnny Storm and his adopted sister Sue Storm get hit with a blast of energy  ,  they acquire special abilities and are taken in by the government and used in the military  .   Fantastic Four is a decent movie which is let down by a disastrous final 15 minutes of shoddy editing  .   The effects were fine for the most part but the editing leaves a lot to be desired  .   This franchise has potential and it is a joy to see something different approach to the comic book genre  .   It will be interesting to see if Fox choose to push on with a sequel despite the obvious financial hit they will take from this latest effort  .   Only time will tell  .
